text: So in our September 2020 paper with some of us on this conversation, we proposed the ONFT model, which is ontologies, narratives, formal documents, and tools.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: ONFT or font works both ways.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And the idea is those are different domains that describe especially remote teams, where the formal specification of the team is kind of an almost perfect map for the actual team dynamics.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: So if you have an ontology of communication, like there's video, audio, text, and file sharing, then you can have a structured system for thinking about those pieces.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: That's ontology.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: it becomes manifest and used through formal documents, whether it's a spreadsheet or a cloud document, as well as tools, which kind of covers the whole range of what we work on on our computer, whether it's an interactive cloud notebook or a .docx, that's sort of in the tools and formal documents domain, structured by ontology.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And then narrative is...
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: what threads it all together.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And active inference hopefully provides us with a way of thinking about multi-scale narratives and holding space for differences in narrative and perspective.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

speaker: SPEAKER_01
